title: Bug 12906 - Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor
description: Bug 12906 - If a file is already opened in one editor, it should give an error message when attempting to open it in another editor.
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor and attempting to open it in another editor, nothing happens and no warning or error message is displayed.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor and attempting to open it in another editor, a warning message should be displayed stating that changes may be overwritten and user should be prompted to continue or an error message should be displayed indicating that all files need to be closed first.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 

1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files. 

2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the java file opened. Close it. 

3. Go to the Java Perspective and open a java file by simply double-clicking on it. The file should now be opened in the workbench. 

4. Now, right-click on the java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. 

The expected behavior is that a warning message should be displayed in the workbench stating that changes may be overwritten and prompt the user to continue, or an error message should be displayed requiring all files to be closed before opening a new one. However, in the observed behavior, nothing happens and no warning or error message is displayed.
